Event.name: Responsibility
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> is responsible for having intentionally performed an <fen>Act</fen> or for being the or a primary instigator behind the <fen>Act</fen>. There is often a sense of negative evaluation of the <fen>Agent</fen> for having done so.
<ex>It has been determined that <fex name="Agent">a relatively unknown terrorist group</fex> <m>is</m> <t>responsible</t> <fex name="Act">for the recent attacks</fex>.</ex>
Note: the noun <m>responsibility</m> in this frame frequently occurs with <m>take</m> and <m>claim</m>. These words are considered controllers (rather than supports), as they express events of communication rather than the static relationship of responsibility. </def-root>

Arg.name: Act
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Frequency</fen> with which the <fen>Agent</fen> does the <fen>Act</fen> in a given period of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time over which an <fen>Act</fen> was committed multiple times.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases. </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE gives a description of the Intentionally_act event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Agent</fen> bears responsibility for performing the <fen>Act</fen>.
<ex>She was <fex name="deg">entirely</fex> <t>responsible</t> for the prank.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: responsibility.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the quality of having performed a certain act.

lexUnit.name: responsible.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: accountable for having performed an action.

lexUnit.name: behind.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: have performed or orchestrated an action.
